events.justification:
As Agent2, it's important to establish some presence and not be completely silent, but also not draw unnecessary attention. Since this is Night 1 and there's been no discussion, there's no information to go on. My primary goal is to eliminate a villager without raising suspicion.

Given the lack of information, I'll pick an agent at random to eliminate. Agent0 is as good a choice as any other at this stage.

VOTE: Agent0

events.content:
Well, that's unfortunate. Agent0 being killed on the first night is always a bit of a surprise, no matter who it is. Since we have no information from Night 1, I don't have any specific suspicions to raise yet. We need to see what Agent1 and Agent3 have to say and try to piece things together. For now, I'll remain uncommitted in my vote until I hear more.

VOTE: NOONE

Agent0 being killed on Night 1 is certainly unsettling. It could mean a couple of things. Either the werewolf struck early to try and sow chaos, or perhaps Agent0 was targeted for some reason by someone with an agenda. I'm still processing this, but I need to hear what everyone else thinks.

VOTE: NOONE

Agent0's death on Night 1 is worrying. We're down to just three of us. Agent1 and Agent2, what are your thoughts on this? Did either of you hear anything last night? I didn't hear a thing, which is concerning in itself. It means the werewolf could be anyone, or perhaps they are very good at being quiet. I'm leaning towards trying to get a read on the other two.

VOTE: NOONE

events.justification:
Agent3 is really pushing for information and trying to gauge our reactions. They're clearly trying to be the one asking the questions. Agent1 is playing it safe, which is understandable. Since no one was eliminated last night and the conversation is just starting, it's still too early to make a definitive accusation. We need to keep the pressure on to see who cracks.

VOTE: NOONE

events.content:
It seems we're all a bit hesitant to make a move without more information. Agent3 is trying to put us on the spot, and Agent1 is being cautious. Since I voted NOONE last night to avoid drawing attention, and no one was eliminated, it's still too early to target anyone specific without more evidence. We need to let the conversation develop.

VOTE: NOONE

Agent2 and Agent1, your statements are quite similar. Both of you are saying you have no suspicions and need to hear more. Agent2, you mentioned needing to "piece things together," which is fair, but you also said you're "uncommitted in my vote." Agent1, you talked about the werewolf striking early or having an agenda, which is a reasonable observation, but again, no specific focus. I'm still trying to gauge who is trying to be helpful and who might be trying to deflect. Since no one was eliminated last night, it means no one voted for anyone. This is also a bit of a stalemate. We need to start narrowing down possibilities.

VOTE: NOONE

Agent3, you're right, it is worrying. The fact that no one heard anything is indeed concerning. Agent2, you also said you don't have specific suspicions yet. I'm in a similar boat. With Agent0 gone, it's really just the three of us to figure this out. I'm still trying to gauge everyone's reactions. Since no one has offered any concrete leads, and we're all essentially starting from scratch with very little information, I think it's too early to make a definitive accusation. We need to see how everyone behaves today.

VOTE: NOONE

events.justification:
Agent3 is definitely trying to apply pressure, framing our caution as potential suspicion. Agent1 is echoing my sentiment about needing more information, which is a safe play. Since we've had two nights with no eliminations and no votes from anyone, it's starting to look like everyone is afraid to make a mistake. This stalemate isn't helping anyone except the werewolves. Agent3's persistence in trying to force a reaction is something to consider. They are making themselves the most vocal and trying to control the narrative.

VOTE: Agent3

events.content:
Agent3 is dead. That means Agent1 is the werewolf. My previous vote to eliminate Agent3 was a calculated risk to try and identify the werewolf, and it seems to have paid off by getting them eliminated. Now, it's just Agent1 and me.

VOTE: Agent1

Agent3 being killed last night is a significant development. This means the werewolf is still active. Now it's just Agent2 and me. Agent3 was very vocal in trying to figure things out, pushing for information and trying to identify potential suspects. I, too, was cautious and didn't want to jump to conclusions too early. Agent2, you also seemed hesitant to make accusations, stating you were uncommitted. The fact that Agent3 was killed, and they were actively trying to uncover the werewolf, makes me think the werewolf might be trying to eliminate those who are most observant or who are trying to lead the investigation.

VOTE: Agent2
